utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: ...sprang to his sleigh, to his team gave a whistle;

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can't believe you're not gonna be here for Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You're really not coming back?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, we have all this paperwork that needs to be filed by the end of the year. If I don't get it done, I'll be fired.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It's so unfair, you don't even like your job!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, who does?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I like my job.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I love my job.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I can't wait to go back to work.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I can't get enough dinosaurs!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I won't be here.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It's just... It's hard enough not seeing you during the week, but for Christmas... alright, if this is what you have to do, I understand.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thanks. I'll see you New Year's Day.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did I not mention that?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right everybody, I know that it's Christmas Eve and you'd rather be with your families, but there's no call for writing "Screw you, Mr. Bing!" on the back of my chair! -- By the way, you can all call me Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Others
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey. Where've you been?

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: I was, uh, checking out that insurance company's Christmas party on three, oh, it was really beautiful, they have all these decorations and this huge tree and I just, uh... to hell with them, we have to work. -- So I stole ther ham.

utterance.speaker: Claudia
utterance.content: My kid's in a play right now.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know what, I know what will cheer you guys up! I had a little talk with the boys in New York, told 'em about all the hard work you've been doing and that a little Christmas bonus may be in order.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, that's like money in your pocket! - Alright look, you want me to say it? This sucks. Being here sucks! This work sucks!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm sorry. Hey, at least you guys get to go home and be with your families tonight. I have to go back to an empty hotel room and lay down on a very questionable bedspread. And then tomorrow morning, you get to have Christmas morning in your own houses, wich, by the way, none of you have invited me to.

utterance.speaker: Ken
utterance.content: You can come to my house!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Haha, no thanks!

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: That was a nice pep-talk.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, thanks! I'm... actually thinking about becoming a motivational speaker.

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: So, if you were home right now, what would you be doing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Typical Christmas-y stuff, you know? Our holidays are pretty traditional...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So here is a, a very special holiday song that I wrote for some very important people to me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, Pheebs, you look in the kitchen, I will look in the back closet.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can save you time ladies, I'm right here.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, Chandler why don't you take a walk? This doesn't concern you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We are looking for our Christmas presents from Monica.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What? That's terrible!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No-no, we do it every year!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh well, that, that makes it not terrible.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, yeah, we never find them! She's always best at us, that wily... minx.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Don't worry, we're just gonna search here for an hour, and then we're gonna go over to Joey's and search, OK?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No not okay, you can't look for Monica's presents!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no, we have to!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, you don't have to, and you can't because I, I live here too.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well then, you should look with us.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler, aren't you worried about what to get Monica for Christmas?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, I have a great idea for a present for her.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, that's it? A great idea! Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler, that's not enough. I mean what if she gets you a great present, two medium presents, and a bunch of little presents? And you've just gotten her one great present? I mean that's just gonna make her feel bad. Why would you do that to her Chandler? Why? Why?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: If I help, we can find 'em faster!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That's right!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh ooh, we have a live one!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, it's a Macy's bag!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, who's it for?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Rach, these are for you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wiper blades. I don't even have a car.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, but with this new car smell, you'll think you do.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: OK, Pheebs, your turn.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ahh, toilet seat covers! Is that what you were doing while I was getting gas?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You guuuyys.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And for Ross, Mr. Sweet-tooth.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You got me a cola drink?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And, a lemon lime.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well this, this is too much, I feel like I should get you another sweater.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And last but not least.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: They're ribbed for your pleasure.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ooh, hey Ben, what if the Holiday Armadillo told you all about the Festival of Lights?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Cool!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come on Ben.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees...

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Santa!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What are you doing here, Santa?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I'm here to see my old buddy Ben. What are you doing here, weird...turtle-man?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm the Holiday Armadillo, your part-Jewish friend. You sent me here to give Ben some presents. Remember?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay Ben, why don't you come open some more presents, and Santa, the Armadillo and I have a little talk in the kitchen? There's a sentence I'd never thought I'd say.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You called everyone and said you were having trouble finding a Santa costume, so I borrowed one from a guy at work!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you, but, but you, you gotta leave.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Because, I'm finally getting him excited about Hanukkah, and, and you're-you're wrecking it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But I didn't get to shake my belly like a bowl full of jelly.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm sorry Chandler, but this, this is really important to me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Fine, I'll give the suit back.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Santa? Really?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, is that okay?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did your Dad ever dress up like Santa?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Then it's okaaay!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know what, everybody? Go home. You should be with your families. It's bad enough that we're working New Year's Eve.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did I not tell anyone about New Year's Eve? -- Alright, look, go! Go home, okay? Merry Christmas! Go.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Good, God's speed, good people! You're not gonna go?

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: Naah... I couldn't leave you alone.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: Besides, I can't leave until their Christmas party downstairs clears out; there are some pissed off insurance people looking for that ham.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah. Chandler Bing.

utterance.speaker: Scene change back an forth
utterance.content: Monica and Chandler's Apartment, Monica's on the other end of the line. The phone's speaker is turned on, so the rest of the gang, sitting around the phone, can hear Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi Honey! We're all here; we just want to wish you a Merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ahh, Merry Christmas; I miss you guys!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So is it horrible? Is everybody working really hard?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah, well no, it's just uh, me and Wendy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wendy? -- That sounds like a girl's name.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It is. Did I... not tell you about her?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Umhmm, umhmm, about the time you told me about New Year's Eve. Where is everybody else?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I sent them home.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh, you are such a good boss! Is she pretty?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uhh, uh...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't know!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't think of her that way, you know, she's a, she's a colleague.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What does she do there?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, she's regional Vice President; She's... just below me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She did WHAT?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: BE-LOW me!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ahh, wait, is Wendy the runner-up Miss Oklahoma?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, she... she didn't win...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Alright, well, maybe I should let you and the second prettiest girl in Oklahoma get back to work.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, second prettiest that year; I mean, of all the girls in Oklahoma, she's probably...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Honey, there's really nothing to worry about.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm serious!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Merry Christmas, you guys!

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: Ah. Fun conversation?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah well, she's got this weird idea, that, uh, y'know, just because you and I are alone, that something is gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: Huh? Really? -- Hm, that'd be so terrible?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This is probably the wrong thing to be worrying about, but... you're getting ham on my only tie.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Whoa-ho, back off, Missy!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't know; I'm not used to girls making passes at me! ... Wait a minute... am I sexy in Oklahoma?

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: You are to me...

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: So? I'm married.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm happily married.

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: Oh. - What's that like?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Right. So, I'm sorry...

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: Seriously? Happily married. So that phone call before, that was ... happy?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well look, it's not easy to spend this much time apart, you know. She's entitled to be a little paranoid... or, in this case: right on money! ... You know, she's amazing, and beautiful, and smart, and if she were here right now, ...she'd kick your ass. Look, you're a really nice person... ham stealing and adultery aside. But, what I have with my wife is pretty great, so nothing is ever gonna happen between us.

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: Okay, let me ask you something: if what you and your wife have is so great, then why are you spending Christmas with me?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I mean, you were the most beautiful woman in the room tonight!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You kidding? You're the most beautiful woman in most rooms... Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What's going on? You and I just made out! You and I are making out?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, not anymore.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But we don't do that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know, I just thought it would be fun.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How drunk are you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Drunk enough that I know I wanna do this. Not so drunk that you should feel guilty about taking advantage.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This doesn't feel weird!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You're a really good kisser.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I have kissed over four women. Do you wanna get under the covers?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hm-hmm!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow! You are really fast!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It bodes well for me that speed impresses you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We're gonna see each other naked.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yep!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you wanna do it at the same time?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Count of three?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: One!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Two!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Two!

utterance.speaker: Both
utterance.content: Three!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well I think it's safe to say that our friendship is effectively ruined.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Eh, we weren't that close anyway!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Eh!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, are you really gonna go out with that nurse man?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well uh, you and I are just goofing around, I thought, why not just goof around with him.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know, I don't know if you've ever looked up the term goofing around in the dictionary... Well, I have, and the technical definition is, two friends who care a lot about each other and have amazing sex and just wanna spend more time together. But if you have this new fangled dictionary that gets you made at me, then we have to, y'know, get you my original dictionary. I am so bad at this.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I think you're better than you think you are.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really? Okay, so...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know, I sensed that I should stop. So we're okay?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah. Don't do the dance.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Right!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can't get married until I get something old, something new, something borrowed, and something blue.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, all right, all right, all right! Okay! Okay, here's something, here's something blue and new.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You're so efficient. I love you!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Let's go!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No-no-no, wait! We need something old!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, okay, I have condom in my wallet that I've had since I was twelve.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That'll work!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't think so.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, now we just need something borrowed!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That's stealing!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, we'll-we'll bring it back! Just put it under your dress.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, one thing at a time.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Listen umm, I've been thinking, it's not fair for me to ask you to spend all of your money on our wedding. I mean, you work, you work really hard for that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ehh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Eh, you work for that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, I thought about it too, and I'm sorry. I think we should spend all of the money on the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You do?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm putting my foot down. Yeah look, when I proposed I told you that I would do anything to make you happy, and if having the perfect wedding makes you happy, then, then that's what we're gonna do.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, you're so sweet. Oh, but wait, what about our, what about the future and stuff?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Eh, forget about the future and stuff! So we only have two kids, y'know? We'll pick our favorite and that one will get to go to college.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You thought about that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How many kids were we gonna have?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh, four, a boy, twin girls and another boy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What else did you think about?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, stuff like where we'd live, y'know? Like a small place outside the city, where our kids could learn to ride their bikes and stuff. Y'know, we could have a cat that had a bell on its collar and we could hear it every time it ran through the little kitty door. Of course, we'd have an apartment over the garage where Joey could grow old.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sure you do.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, I want everything that you just said. I want a marriage.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I love you so much.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really? You're not gonna return it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, not this second!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh wow, it's so beautiful...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow, it really is!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: "Wendy" is a fat girl name.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Aren't we done with that?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Let's talk about snow. -- Do you think it's snowing in Tulsa, where my husband is having sex on a copying machine?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my god...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-heeyyy - Look at that, it's a Christmas miracle!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I wanted to be with you. I missed you so much.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, hey, uh, who did you miss the most?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Monica.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Got ya.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I never want to leave you again!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But I thought if you left, you get fired.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Turns out they can't fire me. Because I quit.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What, you, you really quit your job?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah! It's a stupid job, and I could not stand leaving you. And why should I be the only one who doesn't get to do what he really wants to do?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What do you really want to do?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my god!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know, I, I should have talked to you first about it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, I think that this is what you wanna do, I think it's great!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thanks!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Chandler, your being here is the best Christmas present I could have ever imagined.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Now give me my real gift.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, hey...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wha... are you kidding? I can't return this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I... thought it was a timely start to thinking about other people. Besides, this gift still says I love you guys.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Mine's is to Lilian Myers.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't have a job!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Actuary... no. Book-keeper... no. Topless dancer... Hey, d'you know what I just realized? You are the sole wage earner. You are the head of the household. I don't do anything - I'm a kept man!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You are! Hey, here's twenty bucks. -- Why don't you go buy yourself something pretty while I'm at work tomorrow?
